result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven W Estes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven W Estes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steven W Estes in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty  of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
 SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent to case:  15CT1152
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Zachary Hoff by Atty. Wolff in court.   
Defendant Steven W Estes did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by Authorization previously filed.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Authorizatio to Appear, received and filed in court.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zachary Hoff in court.   
Defendant Steven W Estes did not appear.
Attorney appeared by authorization.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant Steven W Estes in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
